content: I think a very large part of it, maybe overwhelmingly so, is that the people most capable of making such AI systems from an engineering perspective are the people least capable from an emotional perspective. But I don’t think this means that AIs won’t be able to do emotional work in the future. Especially, as Linas Vepstas mentioned, if AI replaces the logical work of today, people will (hopefully) fill in the emotional labor. With a generation of presumably more emotionally capable programmers, emotionally intelligent AI is a natural next step. I just hope they’re built with many ethics considerations.
